summary: This bill, the National Human Trafficking Database Act, mandates the establishment of a national database at the Office for Victims of Crime to collect and disseminate data on human trafficking. It authorizes grants to state agencies to gather relevant information, including arrests, prosecutions, and data from various sources (hotlines, children's services, etc.). The database's information will be published online annually and reported to Congress, ensuring survivor confidentiality. Funding is authorized for this initiative through fiscal year 2028.
